sentence.Network_en: The dismissals came at an inopportune time.
sentence.Network_cn: 解雇通知来得不合时宜。

sentence.Network_en: They arrived at an inopportune moment.
He called at an inopportune moment, when we were about to go out.
sentence.Network_cn: 他来得真不是时候, 我们正准备外出.

he explains how the redemption structure of the previous fund cut his flexibility . or how the banks pulled back on liquidity at inopportune time .他会解释说，那只基金的赎回结构如何如何束缚了自己的手脚，或是银行如何如何在不恰当的时候收紧了流动资金。

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 16th cent.: from Latin inopportunus, from in- 'not' + opportunus (see opportune)

entry.def: If you describe something as inopportune or if you say that it happens at an inopportune time, you mean that it happens at an unfortunate or unsuitable time, and causes trouble or embarrassment because of this.

example.ex: The dismissals came at an inopportune time.
example.tran: 解雇通知来得不合时宜。
